description.para: The set of read objects is defined as the set of objects of type Ipelet_base::Point_2, Ipelet_base::Segment_2, Ipelet_base::Polygon_2, Ipelet_base::Circular_arc_2 or Ipelet_base::Circle_2.

The set of drawable objects is defined as the super set of the set of read objects also including objects of type Ipelet_base::Line_2, Ipelet_base::Ray_2, Ipelet_base::Triangle_2 and Ipelet_base::Iso_rectangle_2.

briefdescription.para: The kernel used to define internal types.
The number type of the coordinates.
The point type.
The circle type.
The circular arc type.

detaileddescription.para: The CGAL::Sign, equals either to CGAL::COUNTERCLOCKWISE or CGAL::CLOCKWISE, indicates if the arc is the set of points on the circle from the first point to the second point turning clockwise or counterclockwise.

briefdescription.para: The weighted point type.
The segment type.
The line type.
The ray type.
The triangle type.
The polygon type.
A type to represent bounding boxes.
Class type providing operators to extract points from segments and polygons.
Class type providing operators to extract segments from polygons.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string fct_names[], const std::string help_msg[], const std::string name)
memberdef.name: CGAL_ipelet

briefdescription.para: initializes an ipelet.

detaileddescription.para: The string name is the name given to the ipelet in the Ipe menu. The string array fct_names contains the names of these functions as they will appear in the sub-menu of the ipelet. The string array help_msg of size one or nbf-1 contains a help message for each function of the ipelet. These help messages can be printed using the member function show_help(). This function expects that the last function defined in the ipelet is dedicated to print the help message. It is advised that the last function defined is dedicated to show a help message.

briefdescription.para: This is an advanced function.

detaileddescription.para: returns a pointer to an Ipe object representing the drawing page. Refer to the Ipe library documentation for more details.

briefdescription.para: This is an advanced function.

detaileddescription.para: returns a pointer to an Ipe object providing services to Ipelets. Refer to the Ipe library documentation for more details.

briefdescription.para: Prints in Ipe a pop-up help message constructed from the string array of the constructor.

detaileddescription.para: This function expects that the last function defined in the ipelet is dedicated to print the help message. When the boolean one_per_func is true, one help message per function is printed (except for the help function itself) using the nbf-1 strings in the array given to the constructor. Otherwise, only one help message is printed using the first string in the array given to the constructor.

briefdescription.para: Prints the string msg as a message in Ipe.
function called when the user selects the CGAL ipelet.

memberdef.argsstring: (Dispatch_or_drop_output_iterator< V, O > out, bool deselect_all=true, bool delete_selected_objects=false)
memberdef.name: read_active_objects

briefdescription.para: This function assigns to output iterator out all handled objects selected in Ipe.

detaileddescription.para: Objects read belong to the set of read objects (even within groups). The output iterator out must be able to handle all read objects (see CGAL::Dispatch_or_drop_output_iterator<V,O>). In addition, a bounding box (Iso_rectangle_2) of the active objects selected is returned. The two Boolean arguments indicate whether the retrieved objects must be deselected and/or removed. Note that non-retrieved objects (primitives of Ipe not handled or objects dropped by out) are automatically deselected, and not deleted. If a non-retrieved object is a sub-path or is inside a group, the whole path or group will not be deleted.

briefdescription.para: returns an output iterator which wraps it.

detaileddescription.para: OutputIterator must be a model of the output iterator concept accepting assignments from Point_2. The returned output iterator will accept assignments from objects of types Polygon_2 or Segment_2 or Point_2, it decomposes them in objects of type Point_2 and assigns them to it. For more details on the returned output iterator refer to the Boost library documentation.

briefdescription.para: returns an output iterator which wraps it.

detaileddescription.para: OutputIterator must be a model of the output iterator concept accepting assignments from Segment_2. The returned output iterator will accept assignments from objects of types Polygon_2 or Segment_2, it decomposes them in objects of type Segment_2 and assigns them to it. For more details on the returned output iterator refer to the Boost library documentation.

briefdescription.para: This function draws in the page of Ipe a given object.

detaileddescription.para: T must be a type inside the set of drawable objects. When object is of type Line_2 or Ray_2, only the part of the object that is inside the page of Ipe (if not empty) is drawn. This function is also able to draw a 2D CGAL triangulation as a group of segments. If the boolean deselect is set to true, object drawn is deselected.

briefdescription.para: Same as above, except that objects are clipped to bbox before been drawn.

memberdef.argsstring: (Iterator begin, Iterator end, bool makegrp=true, bool deselectall=false)
memberdef.name: draw_in_ipe

briefdescription.para: This function draws in the page of Ipe a set of objects given by an iterator range.

detaileddescription.para: These objects must be of a type inside the set of drawable objects. If the boolean makegrp is set to true, objects drawn define a group in Ipe. If the boolean deselectall is set to true, objects drawn are deselected.

memberdef.argsstring: (Iterator begin, Iterator end, const Iso_rectangle_2 &bbox, bool makegrp=true, bool deselectall=false)
memberdef.name: draw_in_ipe

briefdescription.para: Same as above, except that objects are clipped to bbox before been drawn.

memberdef.argsstring: (iterator first, iterator last, bool setclose=false, bool deselect=false)
memberdef.name: draw_polyline_in_ipe

briefdescription.para: This function draws in the page of Ipe a polyline defined by an iterator range of points.

detaileddescription.para: If the boolean setclose is true, the polyline drawn is closed. If the boolean deselect is set to true, polyline drawn is deselected.

memberdef.argsstring: (Triangulation T, const Iso_rectangle_2 &bbox, bool makegrp=true, bool deselect=false)
memberdef.name: draw_dual_in_ipe

briefdescription.para: This function draws in the page of Ipe the dual of a 2D CGAL triangulation.

detaileddescription.para: The edges of the dual are restricted to the interior of bbox. If the boolean makegrp is set to true, segments drawn define a group in Ipe. If the boolean deselect is set to true, segments drawn are deselected.

memberdef.argsstring: (Triangulation T, const Iso_rectangle_2 &bbox, bool makegrp=true, bool deselect=false)
memberdef.name: draw_skeleton_in_ipe

briefdescription.para: This function draws in the page of Ipe the Voronoi segment skeleton from a triangulation of segments.

detaileddescription.para: The edges are restricted to the interior of bbox. If the boolean makegrp is set to true, segments drawn define a group in Ipe. If the boolean deselect is set to true, segments drawn are deselected.

briefdescription.para: This function induces the creation of a dialog box requesting a value from the user.

detaileddescription.para: The string msg is printed in this dialog box. Ipe lexer tries to convert the user input into an object of type T (a simple type such as int, float, etc). If the conversion is possible, the value is returned within a std::pair. The integer of the pair returned is -1 if the user input is not correct, 0 if user input is empty and 1, otherwise. otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Ipelet_base is an abstract base class for defining an ipelet.

detaileddescription.para: The only function that needs to be defined in a derived class is protected_run(int i) that contains the code of an ipelet. Note that the name of the function suggests that the ipelet may throw exceptions that will be caught by a function of the class Ipelet_base avoiding Ipe to crash.

parameterdescription.para: determines the kernel that will be used in the ipelet. This parameter must be set according to the algorithm to be used. The integer nbf indicates the number of functions defined by the ipelet.
